examples: we guarantee that no surcharges will be added to the cost of your trip

noun.description: A mark printed on a postage stamp changing its value.

verb.description: Exact an additional charge or payment from.
examples: retailers will be able to surcharge credit-card users

verb.description: Mark (a postage stamp) with a surcharge.

origin: Late Middle English (as a verb): from Old French surcharger (see sur-, charge). The early sense of the noun (late 15th century) was excessive load.
